binary_file_format.name: Windows_bitmap
binary_file_format.comment: File format for storing Windows device independent bitmap.

data.name: offbits
data.comment: Offset from start of file to the bitmap data.

data.name: planes
data.comment: These files always seem to contain just one plane.

data.name: bitcount
data.comment: Bits per pixel. If 8 or less each pixel is an index into the palette. If 16 or more the pixel itself contains the colour info.

data.name: sizeimage
data.comment: Size of the bitmap itslef - may be zero if compression is zero (off).

data.name: xpelspermeter
data.comment: Horizontal size in the real world - often zero.

data.name: ypelspermeter
data.comment: Vertical size in the real world - often zero.

data.name: clrused
data.comment: Number of colour in the palette that are used - can be zero if not specified.

data.name: clrimportant
data.comment: Number of *important* colours in the palette - can be zero if not specified.

if.comment: Optional info - not sure what this is for but never appears to be used
Colour lookup table. This is not needed if the pixel values are actual colours and not indices into the palette.

struct.comment: One colour - entry in the palette

data.name: bitmap
data.comment: This is the actual pixel data.
